definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: Any deviation from this ideal must be penalized to the extent of the deviation.
sentences.chinese: 任何偏離這個理想，必須扣分的偏差程度。

sentences.english: Is the radian frequency deviation from the center frequency.
sentences.chinese: 是角頻率與中心頻率的偏離值。

sentences.english: The Atkins Diet is a departure from the previously prevailingmetabolic theories.
sentences.chinese: 阿特金斯飲食偏離了以前流行的新陳代謝理論。

sentences.english: Strong cross-winds blew the aircraft off course.
sentences.chinese: 強勁的側風把飛機吹得偏離了航線。

sentences.english: On practice we should not deviating of" Realistic Life World".
sentences.chinese: 在實踐上要防止對“現實生活世界”的偏離。

sentences.english: This argument leads us away from the topic.
sentences.chinese: 這種爭論使我們偏離正題。

sentences.english: Any deviation from the center results in a downgrading during a competition.
sentences.chinese: 任何偏離滾轉中心軸的動作都會在競賽中被扣分。

sentences.english: In this thesis, the driveway deviates navigation system based on the vision is discussed in detail.
sentences.chinese: 本文詳細的論述了基於視覺的汽車偏離導航系統。

sentences.english: That will throw off your body’s biomechanics.
sentences.chinese: 那將會使你的身體偏離生物力學。

sentences.english: Fluorescent film thickness tester deviation, or test method error.
sentences.chinese: 熒光膜厚測試儀偏離，或測試方法錯誤。

sentences.english: Men were departing from the word of God, and exalting theories of their own invention.
sentences.chinese: 人們正在偏離上帝的真道，而高舉自己發明的理論。

sentences.english: Measurement showed the septum pellucid deviated from falx cerebrum and midline.
sentences.chinese: 透明隔移位的測量提示透明隔偏離大腦鐮及中線。

sentences.english: At the same time, context refrains the deviation of hyperbole.
sentences.chinese: 同時，語境制約着誇張中的偏離。

sentences.english: I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有偏離你的典章，因爲你教訓了我。

sentences.english: There was also more spin if the offset position was further from the centre of gravity.
sentences.chinese: 如果腳進一步偏離球體重心也將使球轉得更快。

sentences.english: How did I loose track of my own dreams in the process?
sentences.chinese: 在這途中，我怎麼會漸漸偏離了夢想的軌跡呢？

definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
nothing much changes (idiom); always the same/stuck in a rut
to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
norm/standard/specification/regulation/rule/within the rules/to fix rules/to regulate/to specify
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
